message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.IT, cs.NE 

The paper deals with optimization problems in machine learning, specifically bandit convex optimization and zero-order stochastic convex optimization. These topics are typically studied in the subfield of machine learning known as reinforcement learning, which falls under the category of cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper involves the analysis of algorithms and their performance, which is a common theme in the subfield of theoretical computer science, specifically in the areas of algorithms and complexity theory. This suggests that the paper could also be classified under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) or cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms). The paper also involves the use of Lipschitz functions, which are commonly studied in the subfield of information theory, suggesting that it could be classified under cs.IT (Information Theory). Finally, the paper mentions that the algorithm and analysis can be extended to non-Euclidean problems, which suggests that it could also be classified under cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing), which deals with optimization problems in non-Euclidean spaces.
